isis.stitle: STEERING GENERAL SERVICE INFORMATION AND FRONT WHEEL ALIGNMENT - TIE ROD - INSTALL TIE ROD STEERING ARM AND TIE ROD ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: INSTALL TIE ROD STEERING ARM AND TIE ROD ASSEMBLY

warning.para: When tie rod, drag link or power steering linkage ends are replaced, they must be threaded into the tie rod or drag link sufficiently to allow positioning of the clamp over the threads if not welded on the ball joint end. Position the clamp bolt so it crosses the slot in the rod end.

svcproc.para: This procedure includes installing the tie rod ends to the tie rod.

step1.para: Press key in the slot in the tie rod steering arm.
Install the tie rod steering arm in the knuckle ( Figure 7).

figure.caption: Figure 7. Separate Tie Rod End From Tie Rod Arm

step1.para: Install the nut on the tie rod steering arm. Tighten to the specified value in TORQUE CHART.

Install the cotter pins. If necessary, tighten the nut until the holes are aligned. Do not loosen the nut to install the cotter pin. If the cotter pin cannot be installed, tighten nut to the next stop.

note.para: The tie rod has right hand threads on one end and left hand threads on the other end. Make sure the tie rod ends are installed properly on the tie rod.

step1.para: When tie rod ends are replaced or toe-in is adjusted, both ends must be threaded into the tie rod tube far enough to completely cover the slots in the tube. There should be no binding or looseness in the tie rod threads as the tie rod end is being threaded into the tie rod (Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Tie Rod End Threads Extended Through Clamp

step1.para: If removed, install the tie rod ends on the tie rod to the position marked during removal.
If new tie rod ends are installed, thread the ends equally on the tie rod to the required length.
Install the nuts and the bolts in the clamps. Tighten finger tight.
Assemble the tie rod ends into the tie rod steering arms. Install the tie rod stud nuts. Tighten to specified value in TORQUE CHART.
Install the cotter pins. Tighten the nut until the holes are aligned. Do not loosen the nut to install the cotter pin.
Lubricate tie rod ends. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the proper lubricant.

Check and, if necessary, adjust the toe-in. After checking and adjusting the toe-in, be sure the tie rod ends are properly indexed or aligned (left tie rod end parallel to the right tie rod end) (Figure 9). Proper indexing will eliminate restricted movement of the tie rod assembly. Restriction could cause premature failure of tie rod ends. Tighten the tie rod clamp bolts to the value in TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Proper and Improper Tie Rod End Installations

step1.para: Some tie rod clamps will be free to rotate around the tie rod allowing setting of toe-in while avoiding contact of the axle. There are two ways mechanical stops will position the clamps. One style clamp is limited by a spot weld on the tube. The second style clamp is limited by a tab that will lock against the end of tube. Both styles are shown in Figure 10 .

figure.caption: Figure 10. Types of Tie Rod Clamps

warning.para: When repositioning the tie rod clamps, check bolt clearance between the bolt and axle I-Beam at the maximum turn position, right and left (turn). Interference may restrict proper steering linkage movement, and/or cause damage to clamp bolts.
